data.title: 准备以至少20秒的时间回答以下问题
data.answer: When it comes to a great triumph in the history of medicine that changed the world, I suppose it would be the invention of antibiotics. Antibiotics are powerful medications that help our bodies ward off diseases caused by bacteria. When antibiotics are used appropriately, they can quickly and effectively eliminate infections, making us feel better in a matter of days, and in many cases, antibiotics can save people's lives. Antibiotics can slow the growth of and kill many types of infection. In some cases, such as before surgery, antibiotics can prevent infection from occurring. Antibiotics are fast-acting; some will begin working within a few hours. They are easy to take: most antibiotics are oral medications. Your doctor may decide to give you an injection, if it is imperative that the medicine gets into your system quickly. Antibiotics have greatly changed the world in the sense that they can help fight diseases and infections, and even save lives with strong effects and quick actions.（163 字）
data.referenceText: Describe a great triumph in the history of medicine that changed the world.
data.referenceTranslate: 描述一个医学史上改变世界的伟大胜利。
